articles.headline: Mexican Migrants Carry H.I.V. Home
articles.snippet: Many migrant workers are bringing AIDS to rural parts of Mexico, which are not prepared to handle the epidemic.
articles.abstract: Many migrant workers are bringing AIDS to rural parts of Mexico, which are not prepared to handle the epidemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: PUEBLA, Mexico — Cres has spent almost half his 32 years working in the United States, in the fields of California and Texas and the factories of Chicago and New York. His wife and three children were with him some of the time. But he was alone for long spells, and it was during one of those periods that he figures he contracted H.I.V.

articles.headline: Lawsuit Says Teachers Are Overcharged on Annuities
articles.snippet: The suit, filed against the National Education Association, reflects heightened concern among retirement plan participants that excessive fees are diminishing their savings and enriching financial services firms.
articles.abstract: The suit, filed against the National Education Association, reflects heightened concern among retirement plan participants that excessive fees are diminishing their savings and enriching financial services firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed last week in federal court in Washington State contends that the National Education Association breached its duty to members by accepting millions of dollars in payments from two financial firms whose high-cost investments it recommended to members in an association-sponsored retirement plan.

articles.headline: Ford Seeking a Future by Going Backward
articles.snippet: With its decision to entertain bids for Volvo, Ford appears to be dismantling its collection of luxury auto companies.
articles.abstract: With its decision to entertain bids for Volvo, Ford appears to be dismantling its collection of luxury auto companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., July 16  It was a big victory at the time.

articles.headline: In Battle of Consoles, Nintendo Gains Allies
articles.snippet: Momentum is building for the Wii from Nintendo among its crucial allies: game developers and publishers.
articles.abstract: Momentum is building for the Wii from Nintendo among its crucial allies: game developers and publishers.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA MONICA, Calif. — In the competition among the makers of video game consoles, momentum is building for the Wii from Nintendo among its crucial allies: game developers and publishers.
articles.byline: By Matt Richtel and Eric A. Taub

articles.headline: Judge Rejects Charges for 13 on Tax Shelter
articles.snippet: A federal judge’s sharply worded ruling blaming prosecutors was the latest twist in what the government has billed as its showpiece tax shelter case.
articles.abstract: A federal judge’s sharply worded ruling blaming prosecutors was the latest twist in what the government has billed as its showpiece tax shelter case.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge dismissed charges yesterday against 13 former employees of the accounting firm KPMG, delivering a blow to prosecutors who once heralded the case as a showpiece in the government’s crusade against questionable tax shelters.

articles.headline: Filling Gaps in Iraq, Then Finding a Void at Home
articles.snippet: A rented army of 130,000 civilians suffers and dies alongside 160,000 United States soldiers and marines.
articles.abstract: A rented army of 130,000 civilians suffers and dies alongside 160,000 United States soldiers and marines.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — America has given much to Shaheen Khan. It has taken something, too.

articles.headline: Obama’s Camp Cultivates Crop in Small Donors
articles.snippet: Senator Barack Obama’s campaign has used novel tactics, like counting sales of $4.50 key chains as contributions, to pump up numbers and build support.
articles.abstract: Senator Barack Obama’s campaign has used novel tactics, like counting sales of $4.50 key chains as contributions, to pump up numbers and build support.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 16 — Senator Barack Obama was the guest of honor at a dinner at the luxurious Mark Hopkins Hotel in San Francisco this spring with a few hundred lawyers, executives and investors. The guests drank a boutique beer with Mr. Obama’s face on the label and contributed more than $1 million in $2,300 checks to support his bid for the Democratic presidential nomination.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick, Mike McIntire and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Dow Jones and Murdoch Said to Move Close to Deal
articles.snippet: Dow Jones & Company tentatively agreed to be acquired by Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation on Monday.
articles.abstract: Dow Jones & Company tentatively agreed to be acquired by Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch reportedly moved a major step closer to achieving his long-standing aim of acquiring The Wall Street Journal when Dow Jones & Company tentatively agreed to be acquired by Mr. Murdoch’s News Corporation yesterday.
articles.byline: By Richard Pérez-Peña and Richard Siklos
